overwat
[h1]One must imagine Overwatch players happy[/h1]

The game is fun if you want a class based hero shooter like TF2 that actually gets meaningful updates more than once every four years.
New heroes are initially locked behind the battle pass, but you can get them for free by doing challenges. (though some new heroes are given to everyone for free; the newest hero as of August 10 2023, Illari, is completely free for everyone.)

The community, like many competitive FPSes, is full of toxicity, but thankfully voice chat can be muted and you can ignore most of this.

As for monitization practices, OW1 utilized a controversial lootbox system that has been denounced as gambling for children. Due to increased international legal pressure (for instance, belgum essentially bans games with lootboxes now), OW2 ditches this system in favor of one of the most FOMO-fueled battle passes i've seen.

All skins are now locked behind the battle pass, and there's barely any noteworthy free times to get from it; you have to buy premium to get anything and hope you can finish it on time or else it's gone and  you have to hope they'll repackage any skins you missed in a bundle for $15. Unlike the heroes, there's no way to grind to get skins for free; every skin you have to shell money out for, unlike OW1, which was shockingly generous with its free lootboxes.

The PvE update also feels like a slap in the face, too. PvE for the longest was promoted as the next big thing for Overwatch; a new experience that would form a new pillar for the game. After lengthy, troubled development and tons of scandal within Blizzard, they finally give us a heavily scaled back version of what they originally planned.... and you can't even play it unless you sign up for ANOTHER premium purchase alongside the battle pass, but don't worry, they still have one small event mission to play that's basically just a glorified version of the limited Uprising events they did in OW1. 

Honestly, I was more than willing to give OW2 a good review, but the way they handled PvE pushed any good will I had for this game into the trash. If you have friends that play it, do play it with them, it really is fun, but don't get suckered into their moneymaking schemes; it's clear ActiBlizz only cares about your money rather than giving OW fans the best experience possible.

Is Blizzard a garbage company? Yes. Does Blizzard take advantage of its players? Yes. Does Blizzard make promises to its players and then backtrack 100%? Yes. Do I like Blizzard? No.

However, Overwatch 2 by itself and as a standalone game is pretty fun. Also it is free. Yes, Blizzard tries to gouge its players but really, how is this different than any other company in the world? Why not play the game for free, and not buy anything?

Let's be clear: Overwatch 2 is a free game, with free multiplayer servers. Regardless of what features you think deserve to be in the game, or how much you hate Blizzard, or how butt-hurt you are by broken promises, how can you complain about free? It's polished, it's fun, and it's FREE! You entitled crying monkeys. Get over yourself. If the game didn't run well, or if it had an insane amount of bugs, or just wasn't good, I could see a reason for the 'Negative Review Outcry'. But it runs and looks great! Blizzard is ass but you really can't beat free, and if you're too stupid to not buy pointless cosmetics then you have bigger problems than your hate for a free game.
